Article.Abstract: Two anti-amyloid-beta human antibody-producing cell lines were established from amyloid-beta (Abeta)-selected lymphocytes from peripheral blood of healthy adults. ELISA and Western blot analysis showed that the monoclonal antibodies bound with high affinity to the 43 amino acid-long amyloid-beta peptide. The antigen epitope of these antibodies encountered within amino acids 1-16 of the amyloid-beta peptide. The antibodies did not bind to several immunoglobulin light chain amyloids (AL) and amylin. One of the monoclonals was tested by immunohistochemistry for the binding to frozen sections of brains derived from patients with Alzheimer's disease. It specifically and intensively stained diffuse and core amyloid-beta plaques; whereas, sections from normal brains were not stained. Concomitant staining with a commercial mouse anti-amyloid-beta monoclonal antibody co-localized with that of the human antibody. Simultaneous staining with the human antibody and Congo red implied that the antibody binds primarily to an early immature form of beta-amyloid. Human monoclonal antibodies, which resemble physiologically normal non-pathogenic and possibly protective antibodies in healthy adults, might be attractive candidates for immune therapy of Alzheimer's disease.
Article.ArticleTitle: Human monoclonal antibodies against amyloid-beta from healthy adults.
Article.Affiliations: Experimental Pathology, The Hebrew University-Hadassah Medical School, POB 12272, Jerusalem 91120, Israel.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Adult; Age Factors; Aged; Aged, 80 and over; Alzheimer Disease(metabolism); Amyloid beta-Peptides(immunology); Antibodies, Monoclonal(immunology); Antibody Specificity; Binding Sites, Antibody; Blotting, Western(methods); Brain(metabolism; pathology); Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay(methods); Epitopes(immunology; metabolism); Humans; Hybridomas; Immunoglobulin Isotypes(metabolism); Immunohistochemistry(methods); Middle Aged; Peptide Fragments(immunology); Rosette Formation(methods); Titrimetry

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Peptide AB1-43 was used to fish lymphocytes from donated healthy human blood to establish two monoclonal antibody-producing cell clones (L11.3 and L5). The L5 line was made an hybrid with a murine plasmacytoma cell line to establish clone HyL5.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The beta-amyloid peptide 1-43 was reactive with the epitope-specific mAbs in Western-blot, direct ELISA and competitive ELISA. From the latter assay, the IC50 of soluble peptide required to inhibit binding to solid-phase bound peptide was calculated. The L11.3 Ab required an IC50 of 52 nM and mAb HyL5 an IC50 of 34 nM.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Peptide AB1-43 was used to fish lymphocytes from donated healthy human blood to establish two monoclonal antibody-producing cell clones (L11.3 and L5). The L5 line was made an hybrid with a murine plasmacytoma cell line to establish clone HyL5.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lysates of SK-NSH cells over-expressing amyloid protein precursor (APP) were not reactive with the epitope-specific antibodies in Western-blot. Similarly, non-beta amyloid samples (two from patients with lambda chain amyloid, one from a patient with kappa chain amyloid and one from a patient with islet polypeptide amyloid) were not reactive in ELISA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy donor polyclonal IgG commercial preparation was used.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A commercial IgG preparation from healthy donors reacted weakly with the epitope in ELISA.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: A commercial rabbit anti-Aβ(1–42) serum was tested.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A commercial rabbit anti-Aβ(1-42) serum was tested.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Overlapping peptide analysis showed that the polyclonal serum is reactive with the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Peptide AB1-43 was used to fish lymphocytes from donated healthy human blood to establish two monoclonal antibody-producing cell clones (L11.3 and L5). The L5 line was made an hybrid with a murine plasmacytoma cell line to establish clone HyL5.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Overlapping peptide analysis indicate the epitope for this antibody is within aa 1-16 of AB1-43 peptide.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Peptide AB1-43 was used to fish lymphocytes from donated healthy human blood to establish two monoclonal antibody-producing cell clones (L11.3 and L5). The L5 line was made an hybrid with a murine plasmacytoma cell line to establish clone HyL5.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific antibody bound to the amyloid plaques of the brain of an Alzheimer's disease patient.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: A commercial rabbit anti-Aβ(1–42) serum was tested.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A commercial rabbit anti-Aβ(1-42) serum was tested.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope 1-43 was reactive with the epitope-specific antisera in Western-blot, direct ELISA and competitive ELISA. From the latter assay, the IC50 of soluble peptide required to inhibit binding to solid-phase bound peptide was calculated.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Serum samples from healthy adults, healthy aged donors (>60 y) and diseased (Alzheimer's Disease) patients were tested.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from healthy, aged and diseased (Alzheimer's disease) patients reacted with AB1-43 peptide, but only marginal IgM activity could be detected.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Serum samples from healthy adults, healthy aged donors (>60 y) and diseased (Alzheimer's Disease) patients were tested. Also a commercial pool of IgG from normal donors was tested.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from healthy, aged and diseased (Alzheimer's Disease) patients reacted with AB1-43 peptide; as well as did a commercial IgG preparation. For the healthy donors, most of the individuals tested possessed IgG antibodies to AB1-43.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy donor polyclonal IgG commercial preparation was used.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A commercial IgG preparation from healthy donors reacted weakly with the epitope in ELISA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A commercial mAb was tested. The immunogen peptide is linked to KLH via an extra C-terminal Cys residue.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific mAb reacted with the AB1-16 and AB1-43 peptides in direct and competitive ELISA. From the latter assay, the IC50 of soluble AB1-43 peptide required to inhibit binding to solid-phase bound peptide was calculated.
